1.description: A hobbit of fifty years, cousin to Bilbo Baggins. Lives alone at Bag End after Bilbo's mysterious departure seventeen years ago.

2.description: Bearer of the One Ring of Power, inherited from Bilbo. Must leave the Shire to prevent Sauron from reclaiming the Ring.

13.description: Wounded by a Morgul-blade at Weathertop after putting on the Ring. The wound causes him to fade between the worlds of the seen and unseen.

18.description: Healed by Elrond's power in Rivendell. Recovers from the Morgul-wound that nearly claimed his life.

20.description: Volunteers to destroy the Ring in Mount Doom after the Council of Elrond. Becomes the leader of the quest to save Middle-earth.

2.description: Frodo's loyal gardener who was caught eavesdropping on Gandalf's conversation. Despite the danger, he insists on accompanying his master.

20.description: Chosen as a member of the Fellowship of the Ring. His loyalty to Frodo makes him an essential companion for the quest.

6.description: Frodo's younger cousin who reveals he has known about Frodo's secret plans all along. Insists on joining the journey.

20.description: Becomes a member of the Fellowship of the Ring, representing the Shire alongside his companions.

5.description: A young hobbit who joins Frodo and Sam on their journey. Curious and sometimes reckless, but brave when needed.

20.description: Despite his youth, becomes a member of the Fellowship of the Ring to help destroy the One Ring.

1.description: A wizard who returns to the Shire with urgent news about Bilbo's ring. Known for his wisdom and magical abilities.

2.description: Reveals the true nature of the One Ring and the growing threat of Sauron. Urges Frodo to leave the Shire immediately.

18.description: Returns to Rivendell after a long absence, having been imprisoned by Saruman. Explains the growing threat and his escape.

20.description: Becomes the leader and guide of the Fellowship of the Ring, sworn to protect Frodo on his quest to Mount Doom.

24.description: Confronts the ancient evil known as Durin's Bane at the Bridge of Khazad-d没m in a desperate stand to protect the Fellowship.

11.description: A mysterious Ranger who approaches the hobbits at the Prancing Pony, claiming Gandalf sent him to watch for them.

12.description: A skilled tracker and warrior who knows the wild lands. Leads the hobbits away from the roads to avoid the Black Riders.

19.description: Revealed to be Aragorn son of Arathorn, the rightful heir to the throne of Gondor and Arnor. A descendant of Isildur.

20.description: Joins the Fellowship of the Ring as its warrior and tracker, sworn to protect Frodo on the quest to destroy the Ring.

19.description: A warrior of Gondor who came to Rivendell seeking counsel about a dream. Son of Denethor, the Ruling Steward of Gondor.

20.description: Becomes a member of the Fellowship of the Ring, representing Gondor. Believes the Ring should be used to defend his city.

19.description: An Elf of the Woodland Realm, sent by his father to bring news of Gollum's escape. Skilled archer and tracker.

20.description: Joins the Fellowship of the Ring as its Elf representative, bringing his keen eyesight and archery skills to the quest.

19.description: A Dwarf warrior, son of Gl贸in who was one of Bilbo's companions. Came to Rivendell with news from the Lonely Mountain.

20.description: Becomes a member of the Fellowship of the Ring, representing the Dwarves. Forms an unlikely friendship with Legolas.

1.description: Frodo's older cousin who mysteriously disappeared from the Shire seventeen years ago after his birthday party, leaving Bag End to Frodo.

18.description: Living in Rivendell, having aged rapidly since giving up the Ring. Still sharp-witted but shows the weariness of his long life.

17.description: The Elf-lord of Rivendell whose power over the Ford of Bruinen saves Frodo from the pursuing Nazg没l.

18.description: A master healer who saves Frodo's life, removing the shard of the Morgul-blade and healing his wound.

19.description: Calls and presides over the Council of Elrond, where the fate of the One Ring is debated by representatives of the Free Peoples.

18.description: Elrond's daughter, the most beautiful of the Eldar in Middle-earth. Shows great interest in Frodo's recovery and the Ring.

2.description: The Dark Lord who created the One Ring of Power. Has returned to his stronghold of Barad-d没r and seeks to reclaim his Ring.

19.description: The great enemy of the Free Peoples, growing in power and preparing for war. Cannot be defeated while the Ring exists.

18.description: The head of the White Council who has betrayed his allies and imprisoned Gandalf. Now serves the Dark Lord.

19.description: Has fortified Isengard and bred an army of Uruk-hai. His treachery has removed the strongest member of the White Council.

4.description: Mysterious Black Riders searching for 'Baggins' throughout the Shire. Their presence fills mortals with dread and fear.

12.description: Nine former kings of Men who were given Rings of Power and enslaved by Sauron. Now exist as wraiths, neither living nor dead.

13.description: Attack Frodo at Weathertop when he puts on the Ring, wounding him with a Morgul-blade that will make him like them.

7.description: A mysterious and powerful being who rescues the hobbits from Old Man Willow. Seems immune to the Ring's power.

8.description: Tests the Ring by putting it on without disappearing, then gives it back to Frodo without any desire to keep it.

7.description: Tom Bombadil's beautiful wife, described as the River-woman's daughter. Has an otherworldly grace and wisdom.

5.description: An Elf of the house of Finrod who leads a company traveling through the Shire. Provides food and shelter to the hobbits.

1.description: Sam's father, an elderly hobbit who works as a gardener. Known for his opinions and local gossip.
A miller's son from Hobbiton who spreads rumors and gossip about Frodo and Bilbo.

4.description: A farmer in the Marish who helps the hobbits and provides information about the Black Riders.

5.description: A friend of the hobbits who helps with Frodo's preparations but is too afraid to leave the Shire.

10.description: The innkeeper of the Prancing Pony in Bree. A fat, red-faced man who is forgetful but well-meaning.

11.description: Reveals he forgot to send Gandalf's letter to Frodo, which would have warned him about Strider and the danger.

10.description: A suspicious character in Bree who seems to be watching the hobbits and asking questions about them.
A servant at the Prancing Pony who helps attend to the guests.
Another servant at the Prancing Pony who helps with the horses and stables.

16.description: A mighty Elf-lord of Rivendell who finds the company near the Ford. His power and presence drive back the Nazg没l.

17.description: Puts Frodo on his horse Asfaloth to race to the Ford ahead of the pursuing Nazg没l.

19.description: The Lady of Lothl贸rien, one of the mightiest Elves in Middle-earth and keeper of Nenya, one of the Three Elven Rings.
The Lord of Lothl贸rien and husband of Galadriel. Rules the Golden Wood alongside his wife.
A counsellor of Elrond who participates in the Council and offers wisdom about the Ring.
A Dwarf of Erebor and former companion of Bilbo. Father of Gimli and representative of the Lonely Mountain.

22.description: A Dwarf lord who attempted to reclaim Moria but was killed by orcs. His tomb is discovered by the Fellowship in the Chamber of Mazarbul.

23.description: An ancient evil sleeping in the depths of Moria, awakened by the Fellowship's passage. A Balrog of Morgoth from the Elder Days.

24.description: Confronts the Fellowship at the Bridge of Khazad-d没m, where Gandalf makes his final stand to save the others.

2.description: An ancient king who cut the Ring from Sauron's hand but failed to destroy it, leading to the current crisis.

19.description: High King of Gondor and Arnor who defeated Sauron but was overcome by the Ring's power and kept it for himself.
The founder of the Realms in Exile, father of Isildur. Died in the battle against Sauron at the end of the Second Age.
The last High King of the Elves in Middle-earth who died alongside Elendil in the final battle against Sauron.

7.description: A malevolent willow tree in the Old Forest that traps the hobbits with its enchanted sleep and crushing branches.

9.description: An evil spirit inhabiting the burial mounds of the Barrow-downs. Captures the hobbits and tries to sacrifice them.

1.description: An elderly hobbit woman from Hobbiton who participates in local gossip about Frodo and the Baggins family.
Ted Sandyman's father, the miller of Hobbiton. Known for his suspicions about the Bagginses and their strange ways.
An old hobbit from Hobbiton who remembers the old days and shares stories about the Baggins family history.
An elderly hobbit from Bywater who knew Bilbo in the old days before his adventure.

4.description: Farmer Maggot's wife who provides hospitality to the hobbits and helps prepare their meal.
Farmer Maggot's three large dogs who guard his property and are known to chase trespassers.
A hobbit from the Marish area who knows about the strange happenings and the Black Riders in the region.

5.description: A hobbit friend of Frodo who helps with his secret departure preparations from the Shire.

1.description: A hobbit from a prominent Shire family who knew Bilbo and has opinions about the Baggins family's eccentric behavior.
Bilbo's disagreeable relative who has long coveted Bag End and believes she has a claim to the Baggins inheritance.

3.description: Continues to show interest in Frodo's affairs and his decision to sell Bag End, suspecting something unusual is happening.

1.description: Lobelia's husband and another grasping relative of the Baggins family who has designs on their property.

5.description: Pippin's father and head of the Took family, one of the most important hobbit families in the Shire.

2.description: Sam's younger brother, one of the Gaffer's sons who helps with gardening work around Hobbiton.
Sam's sister, one of the Gaffer's children who lives in the Gamgee family home.
A pretty hobbit lass from Bywater whom Sam admires greatly, daughter of Farmer Cotton.
A prosperous farmer near Bywater, father of Rosie Cotton. Known as a sensible and hardworking hobbit.

6.description: Merry's father and the Master of Buckland, head of the Brandybuck family. Frodo's uncle through his mother.

10.description: A gate-keeper of Bree who questions travelers entering the town, particularly suspicious of strangers.

11.description: A poor, mistreated pony bought from Bill Ferny by the Company. Becomes a loyal companion and pack animal.

10.description: A hobbit from Bree who frequents the Prancing Pony and enjoys the local gossip and beer.
A local man from Bree who drinks at the Prancing Pony and listens to tales from travelers.
Another patron of the Prancing Pony, one of the Big Folk who drinks and socializes at the inn.
A suspicious character from the South who was asking questions about hobbits before disappearing from Bree.

18.description: An Elf of Rivendell who serves Elrond and helps care for guests in the House of Elrond.

16.description: Glorfindel's swift white horse, one of the greatest horses in Middle-earth, able to outrun the Nazg没l's steeds.

19.description: An Elf messenger from the Grey Havens who brings news to the Council of Elrond about the state of the western lands.
King Under the Mountain at Erebor, mentioned in reports about the situation at the Lonely Mountain.
King of the Woodland Realm and Legolas's father, mentioned in the reports about Gollum's escape.
The Ruling Steward of Gondor and father of Boromir and Faramir, mentioned in discussions about Gondor's plight.
Boromir's younger brother, a captain of Gondor mentioned in discussions about the state of the realm.

18.description: An ancient Elf-king of the Elder Days, mentioned in the tales and songs shared at Rivendell.

5.description: An ancient Elf-lord whose house Gildor belongs to, mentioned as one of the great Elven kings of old.

18.description: A legendary mariner from the Elder Days, subject of beautiful songs sung in Rivendell. Father of Elrond.
A legendary Elf-maiden from the Elder Days, subject of the greatest tales of love and valor sung in Rivendell.
A mortal hero from the Elder Days who loved L煤thien, subject of the great tale of Beren and L煤thien.
The first Dark Lord, Sauron's former master, mentioned in the ancient tales and songs of the Elder Days.

23.description: The ancient enemy whose Balrog still dwells in the depths of Moria, a remnant of his dark power.

21.description: The first and greatest of the Dwarf-kings, founder of Khazad-d没m (Moria), remembered in dwarf-lore.

22.description: His tomb and the great halls he built are still remembered in Moria, though now fallen into darkness.
A Dwarf scribe who was part of Balin's expedition to reclaim Moria. His final writings chronicle the doom of the colony.
A Dwarf who was part of Balin's expedition to Moria, mentioned in the records of the doomed colony.
A Dwarf killed by an orc arrow in Moria, mentioned in the Book of Mazarbul as one of the colony's casualties.
A Dwarf of Balin's company who fell defending the Chamber of Mazarbul, recorded in the final entries.
A Dwarf mentioned in the Book of Mazarbul as one of those who died defending the colony in Moria.
Balin's father, mentioned on Balin's tomb inscription. Father of both Balin and Gloin.

19.description: A great Orc chieftain mentioned in the histories told at the Council, enemy of the Dwarves in ancient battles.
The ruler of the goblins in the Misty Mountains, mentioned in tales of Bilbo's adventure.
An Elf-lord of Lothl贸rien mentioned in discussions about the Golden Wood and its guardians.
An Elf of Lothl贸rien, one of the guards who watch the borders of the Golden Wood.
Another Elf guard of Lothl贸rien, brother to Haldir and R煤mil, who protects the borders of the realm.

18.description: Lord of the Great Eagles who rescued Gandalf from Saruman's tower at Orthanc.

21.description: The great mountain peak that opposes the Fellowship's passage, seemingly with malevolent intelligence.

19.description: One of the Three Elven Rings of Power, kept by Galadriel and used to protect and preserve Lothl贸rien.
The mightiest of the Three Elven Rings, kept by Elrond and used to protect Rivendell from the Shadow.
One of the Three Elven Rings, the Ring of Fire, though its bearer is not revealed at the Council.

7.description: Goldberry's mother, a mysterious being of the waters mentioned by Tom Bombadil.

2.description: The wretched creature who possessed the Ring for centuries before Bilbo found it. Now seeks to reclaim his 'precious'.

18.description: Recently escaped from the Woodland Realm where he was held prisoner, now loose and dangerous.

19.description: The greatest of the Elven-smiths who forged the Rings of Power with Sauron's aid, before discovering his treachery.

18.description: The former King Under the Mountain who led the quest to Erebor, mentioned in tales of Bilbo's adventure.
The great dragon who desolated Erebor and Dale, slain during Bilbo's adventure with the dwarves.

19.description: The archer who slew Smaug the Dragon, mentioned in the recent history of the region around Erebor.
Thorin's young nephews who died in the Battle of Five Armies, mentioned in the tales of Erebor's reclaiming.

12.description: The chief of the Nine Nazg没l, the most terrible of the Ringwraiths and Sauron's greatest servant.

19.description: Elrond's brother who chose mortality and became the first King of N煤menor, ancestor of Aragorn's line.
The fair form Sauron took when he deceived the Elven-smiths and aided in forging the Rings of Power.

18.description: The dark sorcerer of Dol Guldur, now revealed to have been Sauron in disguise all along.
One of the five wizards, friend of birds and beasts, who first discovered the Necromancer's return.

recaps.1: Frodo Baggins celebrates his fiftieth birthday in the Shire, seventeen years after Bilbo's disappearance. Gandalf the Grey returns with urgent news about Bilbo's magic ring.
recaps.2: Gandalf reveals that Bilbo's ring is actually the One Ring of Power, created by the Dark Lord Sauron. Frodo must leave the Shire immediately to prevent Sauron from reclaiming it.
recaps.3: Frodo prepares for his departure, selling Bag End and planning his route. Sam is discovered eavesdropping and insists on accompanying his master on the dangerous journey.
recaps.4: The hobbits set out through the Shire, but encounter a mysterious Black Rider searching for 'Baggins.' They hide and continue their journey with growing unease.
recaps.5: The travelers meet Gildor and a company of Elves in the woods. The Elves provide food and shelter, and Gildor warns Frodo about the Black Riders pursuing him.
recaps.6: Frodo, Sam, and Pippin are joined by Merry, who reveals he has known about Frodo's plans. They travel through the Old Forest, where the trees seem hostile and watchful.
recaps.7: The hobbits are trapped by Old Man Willow, a malevolent tree. They are rescued by Tom Bombadil, a mysterious and powerful being who seems immune to the Ring's influence.
recaps.8: The hobbits stay with Tom Bombadil and his wife Goldberry. Tom tells them stories of the ancient days and tests the Ring, showing he is unaffected by its power.
recaps.9: Tom Bombadil guides the hobbits to the edge of his lands. They enter the Barrow-downs, where they are captured by a Barrow-wight but rescued again by Tom.
recaps.10: The hobbits reach the town of Bree and stay at the Prancing Pony inn. Frodo accidentally puts on the Ring and disappears, drawing unwanted attention to their party.
recaps.11: A Ranger called Strider approaches the hobbits, claiming Gandalf sent him to watch for them. Despite their suspicions, they agree to let him guide them to Rivendell.
recaps.12: Strider leads the hobbits through the wild, avoiding the roads where the Black Riders search. They learn these creatures are Nazg没l, former kings enslaved by Rings of Power.
recaps.13: The company reaches Weathertop, ancient watchtower of the North Kingdom. Despite Strider's warnings, Frodo puts on the Ring and is attacked by the Nazg没l.
recaps.14: Frodo is wounded by a Morgul-blade but Strider drives off the Nazg没l with fire. The wound is beyond normal healing, and Frodo begins to fade between the worlds.
recaps.15: The journey continues with Frodo growing weaker from his wound. They are pursued relentlessly by the Nine Riders as they make their way toward the Ford of Bruinen.
recaps.16: The company is found by the Elf-lord Glorfindel, who puts Frodo on his horse Asfaloth. They race toward Rivendell with the Nazg没l in close pursuit.
recaps.17: Frodo reaches the Ford of Rivendell just ahead of the Nine Riders. The river rises to sweep away the Nazg没l, and Frodo collapses from his wound.
recaps.18: Frodo awakens in Rivendell, healed by Elrond's power. He is reunited with Gandalf, who explains his long absence and the growing threat of Sauron.
recaps.19: Frodo attends the Council of Elrond, where representatives of the Free Peoples debate what to do with the Ring. The history of the Ring and the growing Shadow is revealed.
recaps.20: The Council concludes that the Ring cannot be used and must be destroyed in the fires of Mount Doom. Frodo volunteers to bear this burden, and the Fellowship is formed to protect him.
recaps.21: The Fellowship attempts to cross the Redhorn Pass but is turned back by a blizzard. They decide to take the dangerous path through the abandoned dwarf-city of Moria.
recaps.22: The Fellowship enters Moria and discovers the fate of Balin's colony - all the dwarves have been slain by orcs. They find Balin's tomb and the record of the colony's last days.
recaps.23: The Fellowship is attacked by orcs in the Chamber of Mazarbul. They flee deeper into Moria but awaken an ancient evil - a Balrog of Morgoth sleeping in the depths.
recaps.24: At the Bridge of Khazad-d没m, Gandalf confronts the Balrog to allow the others to escape. Both wizard and demon fall into the abyss, and the Fellowship flees Moria in grief.
